comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: Info about Bombardier Billy Wells in comments on this photo. Jim Coffey (1891-1959) was known as "The Roscommon Giant" during his heavyweight career, which lasted from 1911 to 1921. Born in Ireland, he lived in New York City. A February 27, 1913, article in the New York Times (here) on the occasion of Coffey's win over boxer Jim McFarland mentions in passing that Coffey had been training with Bombardier Wells. Jim Coffey's bout list at Box Rec.

comment.author: 27391161@N07
comment.authorname: Claudio Gennari ..."Cogli l'attimo ferma il tempo"

comment.author: 75947697@N07
comment._content: Wells's match was with Al Palzer, not "Panzer." Also the date written on the sticker in the top left corner is June 27, not June 26.
